content.body: I presented pattern matching to JSCIG and get some feedbacks
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I presented pattern matching to JSCIG and get some feedbacks

content.body: Some feedbacks are about the confusions/bugs in the slides, I have commented on the slide.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Some feedbacks are about the confusions/bugs in the slides, I have commented on the slide.

content.body: The rest are about the proposal design, and I think we can do better
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The rest are about the proposal design, and I think we can do better

content.body: other feedbacks are not too formal so I will post it here
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: other feedbacks are not too formal so I will post it here

content.body:
Feedback:

```js
when ([ 'go', dir and ('n' or 'e' or 's' or 'w')]):
```

> if I need to write `dir and ('n' or 'e' or 's' or 'w')`, there is no way to extract them out. I have to copy and paste.

if I need to write dir and ('n' or 'e' or 's' or 'w'), there is no way to extract them out. I have to copy and paste.

content.body:
Feedback 2: 

Syntax has too much noise in it.

Question: Why a `()` after `when` is required? It's enough to separate LHS and RHS with the `:` we have. (I don't remember why we made that decision so ...)

content.body:
And the final problem, the current Custom Matcher is too verbose on syntax.

I wish it could be the rbuckton 's unapply form and also bring it to the destructing:

```js
match (val) {
    when (Some(val)): val,
    when (None()): undefined
}
```

And if we have this form, the alternative syntax I proposed in issue #248 will become


```js
match (val) {
    when (NaN): NaN
    default(Magic): console.log("default case with", Magic)
}
```
